info.title: Azure Data Catalog Resource Provider
info.description: The Azure Data Catalog Resource Provider Services API.

get.description: Lists all the available Azure Data Catalog service operations.

200.description: HTTP 200 (OK) if the operation was successful.

get.summary: List catalogs in Resource Group (GET Resources)
get.description: The List catalogs in Resource Group operation lists all the Azure Data Catalogs available under the given resource group.

200.description: HTTP 200 (OK) if the operation was successful.

put.summary: Create or Update Azure Data Catalog service (PUT Resource)
put.description: The Create Azure Data Catalog service operation creates a new data catalog service with the specified parameters. If the specific service already exists, then any patchable properties will be updated and any immutable properties will remain unchanged.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Properties supplied to the Create or Update a data catalog.

200.description: HTTP 200 (OK) if the operation was successful.

201.description: HTTP 201 (Created) if the operation completed successfully.

get.summary: Get Azure Data Catalog service (GET Resources)
get.description: The Get Azure Data Catalog Service operation retrieves a json representation of the data catalog.

200.description: HTTP 200 (OK) if the operation was successful.

delete.summary: Delete Azure Data Catalog Service (DELETE Resource)
delete.description: The Delete Azure Data Catalog Service operation deletes an existing data catalog.

200.description: OK. An existing annotation was updated.

202.description: Accepted. Delete is asynchronous. In this case, the caller needs to read the Location header for an URL to poll. That URL will continue to return 202 until the operation is complete. When it stops returning 202, the response it gives back is the result of the DELETE operation.

patch.summary: Update Azure Data Catalog Service (PATCH Resource)
patch.description: The Update Azure Data Catalog Service operation can be used to update the existing deployment. The update call only supports the properties listed in the PATCH body.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: Properties supplied to the Update a data catalog.

200.description: HTTP 200 (OK) if the operation was successful.

value.description: the list of Azure Data Catalogs.

ADCCatalogsListResult.description: The response from the List Azure Data Catalog operation.

enableAutomaticUnitAdjustment.description: Automatic unit adjustment enabled or not.

OperationEntityListResult.description: The list of Azure data catalog service operation response.

OperationEntity.description: The operation supported by Azure Data Catalog Service.

display.description: The operation supported by Azure Data Catalog Service.

OperationDisplayInfo.description: The operation supported by Azure Data Catalog Service.

operation.description: The action that users can perform, based on their permission level.

provider.description: Service provider: Azure Data Catalog Service.

resource.description: Resource on which the operation is performed.

SubscriptionIdParameter.name: subscriptionId
SubscriptionIdParameter.description: Gets subscription credentials which uniquely identify the Microsoft Azure subscription. The subscription ID forms part of the URI for every service call.

ResourceGroupNameParameter.name: resourceGroupName
ResourceGroupNameParameter.description: The name of the resource group within the user's subscription. The name is case insensitive.

CatalogNameParameter.name: catalogName
CatalogNameParameter.description: The name of the data catalog in the specified subscription and resource group.
